Tools

Stuff we use and we love!

  • Hardware
  • Coding
  • Photography and Videography
  • Books

Some links below are affiliate. I receive a small commission at no extra cost to you.

Hot air gun

Simple to use. Versatile for soldering, desoldering and heat shrinking. Use it with the bent nozzle!

Multimeter

Love the built-in data logger feature with CSV. Sturdy, stable, reliable measurements.

Logic Analyser

Love the accompanied software. The hardware is of well-built quality that is totally worth the price!

Digital microscope

Functional for this price range. I use it to read and inspect small chips, electronic components and soldering works.

Power Supply

I use it to power my PCBs. It ranges upto 16V, 10A, which is sufficient for my low power use cases.

Battery charger

Versatile charger for rechargeable batteries. I use it for both household and electronics projects.

Inventory Management

Moved my inventory list from spreadsheet to this! Integrates with project BOM and fast search.

Vernier Caliper

Yes, it is analog, not digital, but that also means it will last for years! And it comes in a case.

Solder paste

Reliable, good quality with syringe for easy use.

Flux

My only flux!

Clear plastic zip-lock bags

Standardised transparent zip lock bags for storing my parts list.

Stackable storage boxes

Versatile, strong build quality. Saves space too!

USB to Banana Plug

Useful with the power supply unit

Flux cleaning solvent

Anti-static dust-free wipes

Lint-free and strong unlike paper. So it leaves no residue after cleaning flu and flux.

Soldering and repair mat

Versatile, heat-resistant and cleans well after solder residues.

Kapton tape

Heat resistant. I use it to tape down bodge wires too. Versatile.
